abstract: Yahoo does have some influence, the author notes. It has a representative on Alibaba’s board and the right to appoint an investment bank to help run any offering process.
snippet: Yahoo does have some influence, the author notes. It has a representative on Alibaba’s board and the right to appoint an investment bank to help run any offering process.
lead_paragraph: Alibaba is Yahoo’s best investment, and its most frustrating problem. Its 24 percent stake in Alibaba, China’s biggest online retailer, is probably worth more than Yahoo’s entire booked assets of $16 billion. But a future initial public offering, in which Yahoo has promised to sell half its shares, may deliver much less. That is because Alibaba holds most of the cards.

headline.main: Why an Alibaba I.P.O. Is Both Promise and Problem for Yahoo
